body: This came out of discussions in #11354. The current approach that `Column.from_unique_ptr` drops a reference to the `cudf::column`s `null_mask` if `null_count == 0` can result in use-after-free if there are also `column_view`s referencing the `column`. See discussion in https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/pull/11354#discussion_r930808913

Oh right, this is for views so not `from_libcudf` but `from_column_view`. I definitely recall making the API more restrictive than the original cudf version to avoid this type of ambiguity, so maybe I avoided the problem.

title: Constructing `Column` objects from `cudf::column` should always take ownership of the null mask
